channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Someone have left 2 bags of rubbish, 20th September
item.description:
This issue was reported on 6th Sep (Reference: 8127549) and noticed that council have closed the case after marking it Fixed. Please note that, this issue is not resolved. Rubbish is still present on the pavement and requires removal.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Avenue Road, Welling, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flytipped sofa, 20th September
item.description:
A sofa has been dumped in the alleyway between Gipsy Hill and Becondale Road. It has been there for at least a week and is encouraging others to throw litter behind it.

item.title: Abandoned car, 20th September
item.description:
This car has been left in front of my house 53 Hartford road. for months, it’s full of rubbish and is attracting foxes and other pests, I have reported to the council in august and nothing has been done. Please could you let me know if this car can be removed.

item.title: Fly tipping Eltham hill, kings ground SE9 5ED, 20th September
item.description:
Fly tipping has been happening. A few days ago a big pile of rubbish was cleared which was dumped by fly tippers. Now again last night on 19/08/2025 I saw a van coming in to the parking and dumped whole van full of rubbish. As soon as I try to approach they ran away swearing at me.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 134-144, Eltham Hill, Well Hall, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Misused rubbish bin- danger to drivers (5). Summary includes number of times same recurring offence reported since 16/09/2025., 20th September
item.description:
This rubbish bin is daily used for domestic rubbish. Wind often takes debris and bags to the middle of the road and it is an accident waiting to happen. I have already witnessed a motorist and a cyclist falling trying to avoid the debris. The solution is to remove the bin or to apply existing legislation and fine the recurring offenders.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 12, West Eaton Place, Belgravia, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flags displayed all along Sevenoaks Way, 20th September
item.description:
St George Cross and Union Jack flags are still displayed all along this road from Crittalls corner to Nugent centre, about a mile in length! This is totally unnecessary and is not related to any national event, royal occasion or public holiday. The amount is excessive in supposedly promoting national pride and actually it creates community tension and makes some people unwelcome or uneasy. It creates unacceptable visual clutter and a distraction to drivers along this busy road. They will become an eyesore in due course as they will get tatty, torn and faded. Finally they constitute unauthorised vandalism on Council highway structures and as such should not be tolerated by any council. They are no better than graffiti, flyposting or commercial advertising on your property. The flags are still there despite my previous complaint a few weeks ago and I don't accept the response that no action will be taken and thus my report has been closed. You have no excuse to not remove them and clean up our streets of unwanted clutter. Thankyou
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Sevenoaks Way, St Paul's Cray, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dog waste on queens road, 20th September
item.description:
Dog waste on queens road just past Indian takeaway near Sainsbury's, then on the road after the restaurant, following on to the next part of the road all going towards the station all outside those blocks of flats, its disgusting! This is happening every single day now, its not acceptable to be dodging dog poo, on the school run, this carries diseases, this is not right at all. Physically makes me feel sick. When are people going to be fined! To stop this. Please can this be cleaned up ASAP, the area and community would appreciate this greatly.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 121, Queen's Road, Peckham, London
Report on FixMyStreet
